title: Cho'Gath thematic gameplay tweak
body:
TL:WR Cho'Gath's abilities should scale with his size. Not increase in strength, just increase in ranges.

First off, I love Cho'Gath. He's the first champ I ever bought and still remains one of my mains today. His kit offers a variety of builds (some better than others but still) and is varied enough to be fun to play (a good balance between skill shots, targeted and auto). That said, there was something I never quite got with the stacks on his Feast, and the bonus' they gave, or rather, what they lacked.

At the moment, when Cho'Gath successfully gains a stack of Feast, he increases his size, health, and attack range. Now he's bigger and more fearsome, so why do his abilities still stay the same size? Why does my monstrous foot make the same size Rupture? Why does my gigantic mouth produce the same tiny scream as a level 1 Cho'Gath?

**Therefore, I propose a very SLIGHT change to Cho'Gath: Have his abilities scale in size with him. Not increase in damage in any way, but increase the area of effect for his Rupture, increasing the cone size/range of his Feral Scream, and increasing the range of his Vorpal Spikes.**

Currently, Vorpal Spikes does so this slightly already in that the width of the projectiles increases in size to scale with  Cho, so stuff that increases his size in any way also increase the effect (Lulu's Wild Growth, Greater Relic's Storm Shield, Elixer of Iron all trigger this, even if Cho is level 1).

Now whether the other abilities would scale in a similar way or increase by set sizes at different stack levels like his basic attack is up for debate, mainly because I've no method of testing it myself.

So yeh that was my idea. Thoughts? Comments?

replies.body: I like this idea. There are champions that scale off armour or health, but it would be interesting to have Cho'gath scale slightly off size.

Agree, this is the one thing that makes him look really odd as he gets bigger.

Doesn't he go back to normal size when you die? The size thing relates to the use of Feast rather than a level-related thing, I thought. Correct me if I'm wrong.

He has a max of 6 stacks and when he dies he loses half (rounded up) of those stacks. His size increase when he a) gets a stack of Feast or b) levels up his Feast. I don't know if leveling up his Feast changes the size increase from getting a stack (ie lets say hypothetically with 1 point in Feast, a stack increases his size by 5%. With 2 points in Feast, this may change to a 10% increase per stack. Again I'm unsure of this, as even the League wiki doesn't fully cover it and it's kind of hard to test in game)
